Experience Manager of Business Analytics Rinchem Company, Inc. January 2015  – Present (8 months) Chandler, AZ - Work with key stakeholders involved with Rinchem lines of business (transportation, warehousing and freight forwarding) and supporting business functions to define, develop and deploy actionable performance metrics and targets. 
 
- Development of data analyses and visualizations that drive insight and predictive capability into the decision-making process, utilizing business intelligence dashboards and applications like Tableau. 
 
- Extraction and manipulation of data for analysis, as well as development of automated data refresh from selected databases for updating of internal and customer dashboards. 
 
- Integration of information from multiple data sources into single business intelligence application to drive better decision making (such integrating inventory on hand with consumption information to better understand "days in inventory" and inventory velocity for key customers). 
 
- Utilization of statistical process control and control charts to identify when data are trending toward falling outside of the normal range of operational variation for a given process, to proactively identify and resolve issues before they arise. 
 
- Analytical and supply chain intelligence support for Fortune 500 customers who utilize Rinchem as a key partner to manage chemical supply chain activity. 
 
- Analysis of warehousing, transportation and supply chain data to identify areas of potential cost savings and return on investment (utilized in proposals generated for potential customers). Global Marketing Manager Rinchem Company, Inc. June 2011  – Present (4 years 3 months) Chandler, AZ - Significant contribution to development of sales and marketing strategy (as well as oversight of tactical support) for entry into new market segments, new geographies and new lines of business.  
 
- Major analytical, competitive positioning and proposal development role for wins involving large, multi-billion dollar companies within the semiconductor and chemical industries. 
 
- Development and oversight of all company collateral (brochures, maps, case studies, technology demos, signs, advertisements, press releases and promotions), as well as management of external relationships with advertising, SEO, web development, PR and other supporting agencies. 
 
- Initiation of and expansion of online lead generation program, utilizing targeted Google Ad Words campaigns, ongoing SEO-related website optimization, and coordination with more traditional forms of advertising and publicity campaigns. 
 
- Significant project management experience, including cross-disciplinary and cross-cultural teams. Utilization of Microsoft Project and Visio to develop Gantts and process flows. Utilization of lean and six sigma methodologies to streamline and to identify and remove non-value-added activities from internal and customer processes. 
 
- Utilization of Adobe Premiere, Captivate, Photoshop and Flash to develop supply chain models, graphics and technology demos. Utilization of advanced Excel analysis, as well as simulation technologies to test hypotheses regarding how to streamline logistics activities. Senior Marketing Analyst Rinchem 2004  –  June 2011  (7 years) Chandler, Arizona - Marketing strategy, competitive positioning and development of sales presentations, competitive and customer intelligence briefs, case studies and value propositions, leading to multi-million-dollar sales wins with global corporations within the Semiconductor, Specialty Chemical, Oil and Gas, Defense, Paints and Coatings and Electronic Chemical industries. 
 
- Recipient of numerous performance awards and accolades, including multiple nominations and conferrals of the company-wide "President's Award" for taking initiative and ownership involving a major project that had significant impact upon the organization. 
 
- Technology management of Rinchem's sales pipeline application, including customization of and automation of reports. Oversight of Rinchem's contract management system, including selection, implementation, customization and ongoing management. 
 
- Multi-year, double-digit revenue and profitability growth, including successful expansion to new geographic locations both domestically and internationally. 
 
- Market segmentation, targeting, positioning and collateral development to support expansion of new supply chain services and to support successful entry into new markets 
 
- Analysis of complex customer data sets, utilizing lean and six sigma methodologies to identify areas of potential cost savings for prospective customers. Translation of findings into actionable recommendations that were clear, compelling and included ROI and scenario analysis. Senior Product Marketing Engineer Intel Corporation 2001  –  2003  (2 years) Chandler, AZ - Participated in the product development process for microprocessors within the server storage and embedded microprocessor market segments, obtaining feedback from prospective customers and communicating feature and performance expectations to product development teams. 
 
- Benchmarked competitive microprocessor features and performance against Intel embedded processors, uncovering potential weaknesses and developing competitive response. Managed inflow of competitive intelligence, and debriefed sales team regarding key findings. 
 
- Supported product marketing activities for IOP line of I/O processors, including collateral development, customer presentations and product lifecycle management. 
 
- Oversight of marketing activities relating to new processor launches, including the very successful launch of Intel's IOP 321 microprocessor, as well as ownership and management of the division's product roadmap and definition of features and positioning for future microprocessors. Summary I am currently a Technology Strategist at Intel Corporation, working within Intel Labs. I work with strategic planning teams to brainstorm possible future experiences in terms of products or services they should consider delivering, based on people needs, emerging technologies and industry trends. I also assist with the decomposition of these experiences into related usages, capabilities and technologies necessary to deliver the products and services to market. In addition, I work with teams to develop and explore appropriate business models and alternatives to increase probability of market success. 
 
I also manage the intellectual property capture process within our lab, educating and assisting inventors to file more IP, while providing audits of our lab’s progress. 
 
My hobbies include computers and computer gaming, home entertainment systems, listening to music, reading science fiction, walking, bicycling and camping.
